      of this correspondent. Either an address should be null, or serialData.

      from which this object should be reconstructed. Either serialData should be null, or an address.

    • Defined in lib-client/asmail/keyring/correspondent-keys.ts:261

    a key for receiving, corresponding to given key id.

    • Defined in lib-client/asmail/keyring/correspondent-keys.ts:309

    Parameters

    • pid: string

    Returns object

    pair for receiving messages and a role of a given pair. Undefined is returned when no pair were found.

    • pair: ReceptionPair
    • role: string

    • Defined in lib-client/asmail/keyring/correspondent-keys.ts:336

    Parameters

    • Default value corrIntroKey: JsonKey = null

      is a correspondent's intro key, required, when there is no introKey.

    Returns SendingPair

    existing sending pair, or generates a new one.

mapAllKeysIntoRing

  • mapAllKeysIntoRing(): void
    • Defined in lib-client/asmail/keyring/correspondent-keys.ts:129

    This attaches all keys into ring's maps. Theis method should be called only once, and only on a deserialized object.

    Returns void

markPairAsInUse

  • markPairAsInUse(pid: string): void
    • Defined in lib-client/asmail/keyring/correspondent-keys.ts:239

    This marks suggested reception pair as being in use, if it has the same id as a given pid. Otherwise, nothing happens. Suggested pair is moved into category in-use, while in-use pair is reclassified as old.

    Parameters

    • pid: string

    Returns void

  • serialForm(): string
    • Defined in lib-client/asmail/keyring/correspondent-keys.ts:151

    Returns string

    json object for serialization.

setIntroKey

  • setIntroKey(pkey: JsonKey, invite: string): void
    • Defined in lib-client/asmail/keyring/correspondent-keys.ts:162

    Correctly remove previous key and attaches a new correspondent's introductory public key, performing keyring's update and save.

    Parameters

    • pkey: JsonKey
    • invite: string

      correspondent's mail server.

    Returns void

setSendingPair

  • setSendingPair(pair: SuggestedNextKeyPair, timestamp: number): void
    • Defined in lib-client/asmail/keyring/correspondent-keys.ts:284

    This checks given pair and sets a new sending pair.

    Parameters

    • pair: SuggestedNextKeyPair
    • timestamp: number

    Returns void

suggestPair

  • suggestPair(invitation: string): SuggestedNextKeyPair
    • Defined in lib-client/asmail/keyring/correspondent-keys.ts:189

    This function generates new suggested reception pair, but only if there is currently none. If there is previous suggested pair, it shall be returned.

    Parameters

    • invitation: string

      is an invitation string, for use with a new key pair. It can be null. When null, new chain of pairs shall start without a token, while existing one will use whatever token has been used already (if any).

    Returns SuggestedNextKeyPair

    reception pair, which should be suggested to correspondent.
